summary: This bill, H.R. 2196, aims to extend the legislative authority of the National Emergency Medical Services Memorial Foundation.  It allows the foundation to continue its work in establishing a commemorative work in Washington D.C. and its surrounding areas. The bill amends Public Law 115-275, specifically modifying any references to a seven-year period concerning the memorial's authorization, ensuring it aligns with an expiration date of November 3, 2032.
